bug.author: isaco
bug.summary: error: TypeError: init() got an unexpected keyword argument ‘serialized_options’
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
error: TypeError: init() got an unexpected keyword argument ‘serialized_options’ when import streamlit in python3 , w10, anaconda jupyter or cmd console to run py program? <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug: 1.import streamlit as st 2. run 3. TypeError: init() got an unexpected keyword argument ‘serialized_options’ <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Explain what you expect to happen when you go through the steps above, assuming there were no bugs. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
cant run any program , ex: import streamlit as st st.write(st.version) <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
first time it works, but I do a lot of pip3 install packages (testing keras, R, tensorflow..) <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: last ? can get from python: st.write(st.version) Python version: Python 3.6.5 :: Anaconda Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? OS version: w10 Browser version: Chrome
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
what is with versions of protobuf, tensorflow 2. (compatibility)? Installation as administrator also for anaconada navigator 1.9.7, jupyter?

comments.comment:
Associated forum conversation: <denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/error-import-streamlit/554/2>https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/error-import-streamlit/554/2</denchmark-link>
Probably not a bug, but rather an issue with the environment on <denchmark-link:https://github.com/isaco>@isaco</denchmark-link> 's machine.
